result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mecheal Wesley Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mecheal Wesley Jackson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Mecheal Wesley Jackson.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 08-16-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Defendant Mecheal Wesley Jackson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Mecheal Wesley Jackson in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Mecheal Wesley Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #11CF5358. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Verreault. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court in person, defendant Mecheal Wesley Jackson not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witnesses are present. Attorney Sargent is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Ashley M. N.; Ronald C. S.; Calvin D. P.; & Mobil Gas Station-3510 N. 7th Street
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mecheal Wesley Jackson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Mecheal Wesley Jackson in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mecheal Wesley Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense challenges probable cause for counts 4 and 5 due to lack of positive identification within the criminal complaint, Court denies motion. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
